definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to bow respectfully with clasped hands/to beg humbly
to bow and scrape/to act servilely
the Emperor's body/Holy body/the current reigning Emperor
to carry out a task personally/to take responsibility for
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]

sentences.english: The East Indian woman bows to me, by way of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 东印度妇女朝我鞠个躬，表示感谢。

sentences.english: Pandu bowed again, this time deeply and reverently. "Now I am truly indebted to you, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 潘杜又再次鞠个躬，这回他可是真的弯下腰来了。

sentences.english: Every time, he would listen quietly, bowing courteously before leaving.
sentences.chinese: 每一次，他都静静听，然后很有礼貌地鞠个躬离开。

sentences.english: The figures Jean forward in an excessively polite and courteous bow.
sentences.chinese: 人物都向前倾斜，过分谦卑地鞠着躬。

sentences.english: He bowed to me and passed on.
sentences.chinese: 他向我鞠了个躬，向前走去。

sentences.english: The conductor enters, takes a bow, and all is silent.
sentences.chinese: 指挥上台，鞠了一个躬，顿时全场鸦雀无声。
他一边向后退，一边鞠着躬，真是一种讽刺的谦恭。

sentences.english: The housekeeper bowed very low in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 女管家满怀感激地深深鞠了一个躬。

sentences.english: Standing in front of Mr. Guo's (ex-)home, we gave him three silent bows.
sentences.chinese: 站在郭先生生前的小屋门口，我们默默地鞠了三个躬。

sentences.english: It is good manners to make just a slight bow .
sentences.chinese: 只有微微欠身鞠一个躬，也是很有礼貌的。

definition: to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to greet by raising clasped hands
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to bow with hands held in front
